intro: Hieracium alatum subsp. lamarckianum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy, serrated leaves and yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and botanical gardens.
